lexUnit.name: skulk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: hide or move around secretly, typically with a sinister or cowardly motive.

sentence.text: Then he remembered skulking breathless behind the bungalow until the car was safely garaged , a rush through the gates , staggering along the road till a police car stopped , warnings -- ` Had a few too many , have n't you , sir ?
Aziz spent most of his time skulking about the corridors , snarling at people or banging his pail loudly immediately before and immediately after daily prayers .
This is largely because of its habit of skulking among long vegetation like common snipe .
Their one-time beliefs skulk among the wreckage of their political failures .
people who had made him skulk behind trees until they had passed .
The Emperor seemed unable or unwilling to even raise an army , but skulked behind the walls of Altdorf and dreamed of better days .
As he argued it , he had no option but to skulk in alleys .
A couple of wretches on the run , skulking in the bushes on the lookout for prey , would never have dared break cover and try their luck with us .
No raincoated figure skulks furtively in the shadowy corners of the Groucho club , hissing ` Martin Amis is in .
He saw the occasional pheasant and partridge winging rapidly away beneath him , or skulking in the brown grass and bracken .
She would not be reduced to skulking in the back room of her own shop .
Hyaenas , having spent the day skulking aimlessly in the thickets or strolling in a leisurely way across open ground , now become transformed into determined hunters .
Now , Shelley , tell me what you were reading when you were skulking in the woods today . "
At this moment Badger skulked into the kitchen , loped over to the pedal bin , and stood gazing mournfully at a piece of orange peel , just visible over the edge of the plastic rim .
A creature skulking past the collapsed corner of a building .
Pooley was skulking near to the back door .
` And skulk like a fox ?
There are those who skulk behind and let us run hither and thither while they watch what we find out . "
` Of course there 's more than one British patrol skulking about , " von Mansdorf said .
Skulk along the shore and feed off others " carrion .
And later on , as she watched her skinny little husband skulking around the bedroom in his purple-striped pyjamas with a pork-pie hat on his head , she thought how stupid he looked .
I 'll not have them skulking around my private yard . "
I knew when your lesson was and worked out when you 'd have to leave the house , and I 've been skulking around here , waiting for you .

I suspect that the hon. Member for Livingston ( Mr. Cook ) will skulk around the back alleys of the national health service scavenging for distress stories with which to regale us between now and the general election .

Little enough daylight was left by the time Pedro came skulking back , and for most of the evening she had sat , talking to him , stroking the soft rug of his ear between tense fingers , and waiting for the fit to come again .
I skulked down one side of the garden and went through the arch which led me to a walled garden in the middle of which there was a fountain playing .
` Do n't think you can skulk off , " he growled .
So I skulked round the pub , had a burger and a pint and after embarrasing myself by asking two likely candidates if they were Mark , I shot off .
Skulking about in private passages , listening at doors , betraying your rightful queen . "
After skulking around for half an hour I spotted a kestrel in a tree nearby .
If only she could have seen me skulking around at Cliff Top , the very picture of melancholy .
The crows skulked away into the mist , chattering among themselves that they would be back when the Man had gone , and I hung there helpless .

The game is up and you must skulk back to your own area , full of socks and thick hats , and leave the mysterious , metallic things to people who can answer such a query with a number and a knowing smile .
He shouts especially at Pyjamas , who skulks off for a broom .
` I was n't skulking , I was sheltering from the rain .
